job_title: RN Visit Nurse in Louisville, KY
pros: Rewarding and challenging work from the heart. In depth training and education. Employees are valued and well informed.
cons: You have to be comfortable with your car as your office and making home and facility visits.

job_title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) in Louisville, KY
pros: Mission based. Great work culture. Paid Time Off.
cons: None. I love this place.

review_title: It's all that I hoped it would be!
job_title: Executive Director of Marketing in Louisville, KY
pros: I am touched every day by the warmth and compassion of the Hosparus Health team! Everyone from the top down truly has the patients and their families in mind and strive to make a difference. The smaller employee base allows for more personal interaction and support. You don't feel like just a number here. Some of the pros include hybrid work options, competitive salary and a supportive team from top to bottom.
cons: I feel like this is an exciting time for the organization but with growth also comes some challenges.

job_title: Hospice Admissions RN in Louisville, KY
pros:
Autonomy
Gas mileage paid (beware you will drive lots of miles and sometimes to remote places an hour away in the dark)
MD's/NP's are amazing, so unbelievably nice and knowledgable and always supportive to RN's in the field.
cons:
Constant negative feedback from admissions management. 
Nice to your face, but always criticizing what you could have done better. 

On call. They make you take call for patients plotted to go home from the hospital (they call it a facility to home) and you are expected to go out to their homes, and they can call you, up to 1130 pm at night. Had a few calls at 1125p+ It is mentally and emotionally exhausting. It accomplishes nothing but stress for patients and staff to send a hospice patient home that late.
The schedulers are bloody awful too. Nice over the phone but no common sense. They send you across town and expect you to have a hospice conversation with patient and familia. Then expect you to do all the charting (which takes at least 2 hours, sometimes local fill medications from pharmacies) and be an hour away to another patient all in 4 hours this is supposed to be done. They do NOT care!

pros: I work in the corporate operations aspect of Hosparus, Inc. and I feel that it is a fantastic place to work.  The Human Resources department makes policies well known and adheres to those policies.  The wages are very competitive with a very good benefits package.  It is also nice to work for a non-profit with such an important mission for end-of-life care.
cons: I honestly can think of no cons in regards to my employment at Hosparus.
